page.title: 18PUBLIC HOUSES IN BLOFIELD
page.content: There are now two public houses in Blofield, the Globe and the Kings Head, there used to be a third, the Swan, but this closed down when the landlord retired. The Swan was particularly popular among the older local residents. The Globe is the largest and specialises in serving seafood, especially fresh fish, for people coming from many miles around. It also often has live music groups as well as a games room with pool, snooker and video games. The Kings head is a quieter pub and caters for local residents. They also serve a variety of traditional foods. The pubs have not suffered greatly from the opening of the By_pass as thier reputations remain good.
